position.marginalia_text: Motus & Alterationes Artis Metallica[e] Acceptum prodi non debere, in arcanis Arcanoru[m] legitur. tamen literas siue elementa AV: & E, dicimus esse Mixtiones a[e]quales Materia[e], forma[e], & Medij dispositiui. C, Vero primum motum: 1. Occisionem: Corruptionem: Calcinationem; Vel putrefactionem. G, Secundus motus est: & est Generatio. H, vero, tertius motus, videlicet Augmentatio. D, dicitur Disiunctio, Diminutio, vel Separatio: & est quartus motus. F & B sunt elementa alterantia: quae dicuntur Fixio: Beatificatio: & Vita.

marginalia.translation:
Movement and alterations in the metallic art
Nonetheless we say that letters or elements A, V and E are equal mixtures or matter, form and arranging media. Certainly, C is the first movement: murder, corruption, calcination or rotting. G is the second movement, the generation. Again, H is the third movement, evidently the augmentation. D is called disjunction, diminuation or separation and is the fourth movement. F and B are alternate elements, which are called fix, beatification and life
